intro: Bupleurum mongolicum, commonly known as Mongolian thorned bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to the cold regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its root system is fibrous, and the plant is known for its medicinal properties in traditional Chinese medicine. Bupleurum mongolicum is often used to treat conditions related to liver function and digestive health.
